name: Narikuravar Education and Welfare Society
briefDescription: An organic, grass-roots society.  The charity has been in operation since 1990. The NGO works with villages in ten districts to improve health and livelihoods, setting up community-based groups. NEWS focuses on empowering people to learn about their rights and take action to gain access to available support and overcome social discrimination through giving skills and building confidence of individuals.  NEWS has branched out into these areas having started with a focus on providing education for Narikurravar youth. NEWS still runs a school which provides education for 150 sudents, and runs a hostel which provides board, accommodation and education for 92 children so that they can join mainstream schooling. Also, recently the school has gained middle0school status enabling children to be educated upto grade 8. In the past financial support received from international charitable organisations including Cry, Christian Aid, and the Rotary Club. NEWS currently receives support from Skillshare India.
